reviews.review_msg: Hes monotone and an incredibly boring lecturer. He took ages to give our papers back and the wording on the tests/quizes were super complicated. I URGE EVERYONE TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROF AND CLASS AT ALL COSTS. i am a poli sci major and enjoy the content but he made me dread the semester, and was not helpful when we asked him questions.

Scott is a very nice and helpful professor. However, his lectures are really boring as he talks all class long with a monotone voice. You can not really blame the guy though because the material is just boring. Make sure to participate in tutorials or you will get a basic score of 5/10. His exams are easy if you pay attention and attend tutorials.

Really nice guy, but if you can, avoid this prof.  Or don't go to class.  He's really knowledgeable on the topic, but really boring lecturer. Just read the textbook and the outlines he gives, and study your ass off.  His exams are fair enough, but I found the memorandum he assigned really difficult and not relevant.

Course itself easy, but oh god, avoid prof like the plague. He is a nice guy, but a terrible lecturer and teacher. Makes already dry material extremely dull, never looks up from note, speaks monotone all class. Cannot answer questions concisely and often leaves me more confused. I relied 100% on textbook and outline, stopped going to class.

I really enjoy this class, especially the lectures. They're insightful and quite fun to comprehend. However, be prepared to read BEFORE lectures or else you would grasp half the material covered. I would just say to do the readings no matter how much u hate doing so.

Attending lec is a waste of time, just don't go, better off doing the assignments at home. Did fairly well in her class, although the TAs, took a huge chunk of marks off, for. the. smallest. reasons. imaginable. just to not give a full mark. NO CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA. No midterm, take-home final exam. Treat the class like a 3rd year course.

I didn't really like Clare's attitude honestly, she knows the class material well and unless you do PERFECT its not good enough for her. Ironically, her classes are so boring and theres so much back and forth between subjects that you can't understand enough to do "perfect". Expect to do put in a lot of effort for a mid/bad grade.

This class should be easy becuase its a 100 level class that is a requirement for most, but Clare makes it unnecessarily hard. I think she has an ego and wants her class to be "important", which makes her care very little about her students. I dont know anyone who did well in her class this semester, the grading was unjustifiably hard.

Clare is very disrespectful if you talk to her in person and will not help you do better in the class unless you are doing HORRIBLY: my friends and I would go in to ask for help on assignments, and if you got an 80 or higher she would talk down to you because she thought it was already a " very good grade for this class".
Very unhelpful and when you try to ask for any sort of help she is extremely rude. Would not take her again.
not helpful what so ever, very rude, does not care about students grades and is a very odd marker, AVOID taking classes with her

This is supposed to be a 1st-year course but it feels like a 4th-year course from the amount of heavy weekly readings to the high expectations for each assignment (Coming from a 3rd-year student with a 4.0 GPA). Assignments are graded harshly without any actual helpful feedback; feels like she wants you to fail rather than succeed.

This class is so heavy for a 100 level course. The amount of content and the way it's taught is just overall too much. She seems alright but is very picky and doesn't know how to create clear slides. They're too messy and she often goes back and forth when it comes to content. The assignments were marked harsh and reading's every week were a lot.

I have a 4.0 GPA and I've never struggled in a class quite like this one. The material was difficult and confusing even when a lot of effort was put in. Dr. McGovern herself was a great professor who was incredibly approachable and kind. I think I perhaps struggled as I am not a political science major although this class did feel harder

Clare is rude and will not help you do better in the class. I went to her office hours to talk about my 80 paper, and all she said was "i think its rude that youre trying to argue an 80 with me, im not going to change my mind. Do you understand that that's a good grade for this class?". This class will just drag down your GPA.

Clare was always willing to help students when they need help. However, I found it hard to follow her lecture slides as they were very boring. Majority of the class stopped showing up halfway through the course.

While Clare seems like a great person, I often found her lectures very hard to follow or stay engaged in. Slides were often complicated with a web of random charts and lines and overall just hard to follow. The way she teaches is as if its expected we already know all the terms, even though it's a first year class. Many mandatory readings as well

the course load of this class is not even close to a typical 100-level, I took it after taking previous law courses but general concepts and definitions were largely left out of lectures to figure out on your own. extremely heavy readings that dont get covered in lecture 90% of the time and the TA's grade extremely harshly.

Do not take this course as a first year student. It requires more than a highschool law class-level of knowledge about the court systems, and as one of the first courses you might take, it's hard to focus in lecture and the information is repetitive and bland. Clare gives help, but honestly you might not know where to start when getting assistance.

The course is unnecessarily hard. On average, class marks would be around 70%, which is ridiculous for a first-year course. There's around 40-60 pages to read a week, sometimes more, and we're expected to prepare summaries for each reading for tutorial. Textbook content was largely left out of lectures. She was accommodating, though.

Clare is nice and approachable for questions but this class is unnecessarily hard for a first year course. It's kinda assumed you know some content on the legal system and it leads to so much confusion. The lectures were really boring and had nothing to do with the textbook. If you don't need this class don't take it.

Clare is a great prof who is very passionate about politics. However, this class is horrible. The material is dry, lectures make content even more confusing, and you have to read between 100-150 pages of readings before every tutorial to get participation marks. Clare gave great feedback on assignments, the content is too difficult for 1st year.

Prof. McGovern is an amazing lecturer who is always available for questions and who is very patient when explaining concepts. Her lectures explained the details of constitutional law in an effective and to-the-point manner. Assignments were easy to understand and really did require an understanding of the course material. Final exam was easy.

Professor McGovern is passionate about what she teaches. The cases we studied were quite interesting and engaging. A fair amount of reading is to be done prior to lecture/tutorial. Clare was very accommodating and understanding. Found that she was an easier marker than some TAs. Final exam was long but open book.

Clare is a nice professor and very passionate about the course material. I found it a bit boring but I like how it was interconnected in some ways with criminology due to the fact that it looks at law. The tests and assignments are quite easy as long as you're able to understand the textbook because they were open book. an A is for sure possible!

Clare is amazing at giving lectures and I found them to be very engaging and insightful. Marking is relatively easy in this course with most be I know pretty easily getting high Bs or low A's. Reading is very important for this class, as is attending tutorials. Overall a very good prof, whom I would very much so recommend.

One of the best profs at SFU. Super understanding and engaging. The 2 assignments were fairly easy and pretty interesting in my opinion. The midterm and final were a bit of a struggle but if you enjoy the topic, participate in tutorial, and attend office hours you should do well.

I found the lectures quite boring, but I am not interested in poly-sci, so thats probably on me. The papers and assignments for the class are interesting and not graded too harshly, but the midterm and final were brutal. The fact that the exams were open book carried me to that beauty of an A.

While I have read on these rates that Clare is a good teacher but is a tough marker I really don't agree. She absolutely knows what she is talking about and always hs an answer but for a 100 level course, this is very tough to get an A in. The exams are brutal and Clare assumes everyone is understanding content even though they dont. good luck.

Final exam dropped me from an A to a B which was really stupid. I had a really good understanding of the course content and thought I was prepared for the final which I thought I did fairly well on the exam but it seems like they graded us as if we had 3 days to finish instead of 3 hours. Take this course with another prof.

Clare was a very passionate and engaging professor and was a great lecturer. The two assignments Id say were fair but the midterm and the final were insanely and unjustifiably difficult. The standard of quality of responses expected on tests is (what Id say is) beyond what a normal 100 level course is expected.

Just did the final and I thought it was okay it was exactly how I expected it to be and 3 hours seemed like a long time too. If you're good under pressure the exam shouldn't be too bad for you. It was difficult to articulate my ideas on the 3 essays but I hopefully she marks easy due to time pressure and it wouldn't be the same as regular essays

The final was not what I expected from a 100-level course. It was incredibly unfair how she expects students to finish 3 definition questions with examples, a long case study and 3 FULL essays within 3 hours. She's not a bad prof but how the exam was formatted is horrible. Don't take this class with her tbh

Most difficult and unfair final I have ever taken in my university career. Dont k is how she expects us to finish short answers, a case Analysis, and three FULL essays in 3 hours. Plus, most of the content on the final was never touched on in class, making it even more horrible then it already was!! Dont take this class!!

She is a nice British prof that is super knowledgeable, however, her final exam is so unreasonable. You get three hours to write three definitions, one long case study, and THREE ESSAYS. I did not even have enough time ended up writing absolute nonsense and poor quality of work.
The final was 3 hours long, did not give us enough time. The final will drop your mark, extremely hard

As a poli-sci Major who has taken UD courses, I think that this has to be one of the toughest finals I have written so far. I dont think that this was the best way to test our understanding of the course material. That being said, I can tell that Clare is passionate at what she does and I would still maybe consider taking another course with her.

I took this class as a first year, this is the first political science course I have taken and it was pretty difficult. The content was interesting and I really enjoyed tutorials. The assignments are tough to to do well on, but DONT GET ME STARTED ON THE EXAMS. MIdterm and final are open book online exams and were insanely hard.

The midterm was the most fair and easiest one I have ever taken! (take home, open book). Her grading is not tough, in fact the TA's graded most things and were very fair. Lots of things to get marks for in this class like presentation, participation, 2 written assignments. Exam however, was unfair and difficult. 3 essays are not do-able in 3 hours.

She had given us the hardest most unfair final ever. Not wnough time was given and for the life of you please do not take this course. This final was mentally draining and i dont want anyone else to go through that
Boring lectures. She uploades lecture notes on canvas so refer to them and read the textbook as well. Put some work in. Final Take-home exam is extremely brutal (has 3 essays!!)

Pros: Her lectures are interesting and she's passionate about what she teaches. The marking was fair. Cons: The final exam was BRUTAL (everything else was fair). The course is hard boring for people who aren't interested in the Canadian court system and politics.
Don't take it with her

Solid class, pretty easy and relaxed. The only complaint I have is that it is impossible to receive a higher mark than 87%. They save the 90% marks for those that "demonstrate masters degree type knowledge." This is very stupid as nobody whose taking a 100 level course is going to demonstrate masters degree type knowledge.
I will not take anymore political science courses because of how boring this class is.

very organized prof! seems well interested in the course content, ready to help students. assignments took pretty long to write but she gave clear criteria. textbook readings pretty long, also had to analyze some court cases. lectures are a bit boring but not too boring bc she encourages you to discuss a lot. overall pretty cool prof

She was a great prof. She was well prepared and was very well spoken. The course material was dry, so the lectures were a bit boring, but that isn't her problem. The course was nicely laid out (midterm worth 10%, two papers, and a take-home exam) FYI, the take-home exam has 3 essays along with all the other questions, with 3hrs to take it

I dont know if it was Clare or the course material, but this class was extremely dull. She reads DIRECTLY off of the slide notes that she posts online. That makes showing up seem entirely pointless, so I just didnt. You dont need to show up to do well, just show up for tutorials and do the assignments and youre fine.

Clare was a nice prof. Just so boring. Found the lectures and all readings super dry. It might just be the class. It was just so boring I could barely stay awake in lecture. Also you must do the readings as in tutorial you may be called on to explain what the readings were about. Overall, I did not enjoy this class at all.
Love this guy. Took it his course as an elective and it was actually really interesting.

Never even took the textbook out of it's wrapper. Fantastically easy course if you've got even the slightest interest in politics. But beware the criminology students taking this course. You'll constantly fear for the future of the human race with the crap that falls out of their mouths in tutorial.

The class is super easy; for exams you just need to "memorize" two lectures for the midterm and 3 for the final.  Write down everything from the lecture even if it doesn't seem relevant.  Start the memo early and do it on a topic you're actually interested in.  He's always available for help.  And he's quite funny, especially for an 8:30 am class.

Worst prof I've had so far. Not only boring and uninteresting but petty and rude when shown up by his TA's. Waited until a few weeks before the final to tell us that all the anecdotes that he had been sharing (and nobody I know was writing down) were actually "case studies" and we were goin to be tested on them. Thanks for the heads up dude.
Great class, great prof. However I do agree the text was a bit dry but he didn't write it someone else did and it did relate very well to the material we covered.

Clarke is a good prof. The class was a good class. The text was not good. Keep these things separate! If you read the supporting articles and thought about them you'd find neither the prof nor the class boring. For the 1st year "know it alls" just wait until you get a truly boring prof. Clarke isn't

Nice guy but soooo boring! He is such an attractive person and he LOOKS like he should be interesting! The text is AWFUL though and the lectures are unbearble! Usually heated topics like same sex marriage are made boring! Also the T.A.'s marked WAY to hard! The class average was super low!
The classes are extremely boring.  Text is also boring and difficult to read.  Exams are based more on text then lectures. He seems like an ok guy.
He's a really nice guy, but his lectures aren't put together very well, so the course material isn't very clear. But with a good TA, it is totally survivable.
No Comments
The guy seems really nice but I think he just got stuck with a boring class to teach.
You know you need to learn from your T.A. if he teachs the class better than you.  Overall nice guy but the classes are just boring

Brian is hard to understand, but class is super easy. The questions on review guides were exact questions on midterm + final (easy to answer if took as many notes as possible in class + check lec slides). He likes quantity over quality. if you show up a couple times in tut, he will always mark you present. Overall easy class if you pay attention.

David is a perfect example of a student's dream professor. While he is funny and lighthearted, he has a huge interest for the subject he teaches and ensures he does everything possible to help you succeed, whether it be extra office hours or extensions. He makes lectures very engaging and breaks down concepts very well. Definitely would take again!

Took this class online. Unclear guidelines on all assignments. Was difficult to reach regarding questions. Course was unclear and dense. There were no lectures, discussions or guideance of any type. Truly dissapointing.

do not take this class online - unclear criteria for all assignments, very very little feedback which provides little to no help on future assignments, outdated and seemingly irrelevant readings that are dense and a very "do-it-yourself" structure for the course. Very little is done to aid your understanding, just take pol100

Textbook was dry, his lectures were dry, and his power points were poorly organized (some were in document form). However, the professor was nice and he tried to make jokes. Overall, not a difficult class (it is an introductory course after all) but could have been made easier with better study material.
Textbook was very difficult to read. Assignments were fair. Final wasn't that bad, lots of essays

Paddy was an amazing prof! His lectures were a bit confusing as he'd go off topic quite a bit, but the content's all available on his powerpoints (posted online) and his textbook. His exams were just essays and he'd give you the questions to study prior. Homework was really easy - 1 group presentation + 1 memorandum (paper). You can do well easily.

His lectures are really long and dry. Tutorials help a lot, so don't skip those. His grading for the midterm, memo, and final is rather easy. You just have to study and you should be able to do alright.
Extremely nice. Very passionate and generally funny. Not a difficult class, but the content can be a bit dry at time. Converse shoes are a must.

He is a very nice person but quite difficult to understand in class because he mumbles. He had a lot of guest speakers which are hit and miss. The textbook is essential but it needs a few rereadings for you to get everything.

A very nice man and a good professor. Read the textbook several times until you really understand and listen to his examples in lecture and you will do well. He's a fair marker and very funny. Also does a great job bringing in guest speakers.

Took this class Distence Education.  Textbook is absolutely horrid and dry...material is boring as hell.  Also, no communication with the prof at all, and assignment questions were vague.  Take this class only if it's mandatory.
DE - TEXTBOOK SUCKED. ONLY TAKE THIS CLASS IF IT IS MANDATORY. ITS SIMPLE WORK BUT THE TEXTBOOK SUCKED AND HE ISN'T VERY CLEAR WHEN U ASK HIM QUESTIONS!

I found Paddy Smith to be a very engaging and approachable professor. and because of his passion for the subject matter he was able to give that back to his students. He has a great sense of humor ( always wearing hightops and shorts). his textbook could use some editing however.
Fabulous professor, and extremely helpful. Great with students who actually seek him out in office hours. Nice guy.

Took this class DE. Marks based on 5 500 word and 1 1500 word papers. The essay questions were often confusing and unclear. He was non-existent. However, his TA Agnes was very helpful and sent out an outline of EXACTLY what she wanted. His text is horrendous to read and outdated. If you listen to Agnes, you should do fine. I ended up with an A+.
The text IS a pain to read. But you need it to succeed. Take key facts from each chapter and memorize it. He is a very fair and kind prof.

Man this class was bad. Seems like a great guy but as a prof he's terrible. Textbook is confusing as hell as are his lectures. Not necessarily because of the material but because of the way each (the text and lectures) have been laid out.

This guy knows his stuff, but does not know how to write a textbook. The book is a piece of crap only suitable for the purposes of using as firewood. Communication in DE is lacking also. Burn his book.

Took this course through DE. The prof seems really caring and knowledgable. However, his textbook is an absolute mess. 400 pages of size 10 plain text. The text does little to help you understand the material and runs on and on and on with examples which at the end, is near impossible to show clarity to what he meant to say. Stay away from 151.
Took distance education. Excellent Prof. Really cares about helping you and making sure you do well. I would highly recommend him. He is just an great person.
distance ed course, VERY boring and confusing...textbook is useless and jumbled...prof wrote it himself..i would NOT recommend this course unless you ABSOLUTELY need it...tough marker as well

Paddy is a very friendly professor.  POL 151 material is quite dry, but Paddy manages to make the information much more interesting.  The textbook is a bit difficult to read, but it is a MUST read for this course.  He gives out exam questions in advance so you prepare and do the questions in advance you will ace the exam. Tutorials are nice too.
He is totally incomprehensible, very passionate about the material but very confusing to understand and to make matters worse he wrote the text... :S

I took 151 by distance. I actually had a lot of fun though the text is quite hard to understand. Since it was by distance we had a course guide which sorta clarified the text. Also, Paddy seems really nice I only met him on the day of the final and i sorta wished i could have taken the in person class instead.

Paddy seems like a really nice guy, but taking this course Distance Ed. is not recommended.  The only feedback from him is written in most cases and totally illegible.  Also, apparently if you take the course on-campus you get the exam questions ahead of time.  No fair!
He is a good guy and he very care his student..on marking, u at least get C+ even u write something BS on Assignmet. But his textbook is very messy...

I took this class by Distance ED. What a mistake. Paddy is cool guy in person. I like his attitude. He is a bit of a hard marker in DE tho. The worst part was his textbook. Its a peice of crap. Its way to detailed for intro. Also the writin in it is terrible. The font made it feel like my eyes were bleeding. FORTHELOVEOFGOD, CHANGE YOUR BOOK PADDY!

Textbook is expensive, in Arial Narrow size 9 font and reads like a long-winded optical illusion, HOWEVER, Paddy is a gem. He is extremely helpful, knows his subject well, and has great connections for internships!

He knows what he's talking about and is interesting enough so u better listen in lecture. And pay attention in tutorials!!! His textbook is a mixed bag of run on examples and actual facts so it's impossible to understand. Nice guy but i got more out of Cat in the Hat than his text.

The text was the worse ever. I ended up reading 4 chapters only, gambling that 3 of them will be on the final exam(i was lucky!lol)I didnt find the lectures helpful.Paddy is knowledgable, but he expects it's difficult to follow the contemporary issues he blabbers on abt when you actually know nothing.

Distance Ed-I would not recommend. Since there are no lectures,your source of knowledge is his textbook.Awww his dreadful textbook.It seems like he wrote randomly-just like a bunch of journal entries.The is no logical flow to his written style.His marking is very tough.My main problem with this course is the TEXTBOOK.I'll use it as firewood!

One of the best professors I have ever had! Extremely helpful and clear about what is going to be on exams. (He gives u half the questions ahead of time!) Text is dry, however the lectures are what u need to pay attention to in order to do well on exams. Gives real examples, good teacher. If u pay attention u will do well, I recommended this course
THe rotating sneaker colors where hilarious. THe text was rather dry but could be applied quite well to the tests. Very fair with letting you know what was on each exam. Tutorials where the greatest

good-natured professor, w/ a great sense of humor. Lectures are not straightforward, a little unclear with funny digressions--can get annoying at times when you just want to learn something, and he's trying to entertain instead. But overall, good course.
Whats up with the multiple varieties of technocolour sneakers?
The textbook was so boring I wanted to cry. I didn't really like the class, but at least his exams were structured fairly.

the lectures were boring and slow. the text was confusing and disjointed and poorly written. best part was the fact that exam questions were given out a week ahead of the exam. if not for my great ta, this course would've been unbearable.
Paddy is by far the best prof i have had at SFU. He manages to take any material and make it interesting. HE'S FABULOUS. (and who can go wrong with red cons and shorts - all year round!!)
his book sucks!
The text isn't that helpful and confusing at times but he's a great prof. Actually made class interesting with his sense of humour.
Awesome. Very cool guy. One of my best profs in 3 years at SFU
text sucks. never understood anything in lectures so it was a waste of time. essay based exams & gave questions to the final exam beforehand.
his handwriting on feedback on assignments is illegible. his textbook is pathetic. it has over 150 typos and editing errors. it's a disgrace.
Paddy is so old school!  Awesome prof, always wears shorts, funny!
very interesting class, and fair assignments / tests, plus he's so nice / funny!
text sux~!! he's certainly a nice prof.
Great Prof. Great Guest Lecturers.
funny, text sucks, lectures are good. love the sneaks
Good prof. Gave exam questions prior to exam. can't ask for any more
Funny guy, wears the same funny outfit every week. Tells good stories
No Comments
Great jolly fellow.  Funny!!!  Easy marker.
Love his classic All-Stars sneakers! A real jolly fellow.
Santa?
Evaluation of Submitted Work is Brutal!  Lectures well done, text needs editing!
Exams are difficult
Great guy; wears shorts in the snow and always makes you chuckle.

The TA's  are the only downfall. So unapproachable and give very little feedback. Midterm/final was rather difficult only due to the fact that the essay questions are worth half of the exam marks and you really have to know the content to get full marks on them. otherwise he's a good prof.

Laurence is really funny and chill during lectures, he makes funny jokes. The material is very boring but he makes it fun and I never used the textbook unless it was for the assignments. He also ran my tutorials which was nice when you have questions. The mid term and exam was moderate, he does give hints about what is going to be on them.

easy class with fair exams, don't but a textbook cause you will never use it. If you study the slides you will be good to go and pass the class with flying colours. Only downside was the TAs marking was very inconsistant and your grade on papers fully depended on which TA marked it

Great prof! Lectures are always lighthearted and not droning. Marking was inconsistent, because the TAs switch papers so your TA may not mark your assignment. Midterm and final are reasonable difficulty, nothing too bad. Course readings were boring but not test material, only lectures and slides. He's nice during office hours, and will help with hw
Great prof! Took his POL 151 class and just now finishing up the term. I highly recommend him; great lectures and is very approachable and gives thoughtful responses!

Laurence is a very funny guy. he cracks jokes related to lecture material which truthfully helped me retain the knowledge. He is very helpful and understanding of student situations. His lectures are very helpful and he directly covers any materials he will be quizzing you on. textbook is not required but did help in some instances
Amazing prof, the courses are ok but he makes them interesting. Incredible helpful and a great guy to talk to. Some papers but clear outlines and a good marker. Very highly recommend him

Mike is a tremendous professor and a case study on how to treat your students with kindness, respect, and humility. In all my interactions with him, I always felt like I was talking to someone who cared about my success in the course. Put simply, he is a must-take for any student, and will be the standard you evaluate your future profs against.
A very funny prof, he provides lots of support and has tons of enthusiasm. I would recommend him for any course in POL. Exams and assignments are very straightforward, there are no surprises.

Good prof. Class is not too hard. Weekly assignments every week but it is just a completion mark, so no stress. Final exam is a take-home exam (24 hr exam and it is 2 mini-essays). Research essay is a bit hard if you can't think of a topic. Class is manageable and readings are around 30 pages. TA marked super harshly though. Interesting class.

He was truly ahead of his time. Take any classes you can with him. You will have to work for your grade but its doable if you attend lectures and keep up with deadlines. I didn't feel overwhelmed at all and that usually happens with pol-sci courses given that they're so intensive. My TA was awesome as well, overall a very positive experience.
He is a kind professor who cares about his students and he is a fair marker. Put in the work and you will get a good grade!

Stewart's a bit disorganized and sometimes forgets to post lecture slides. He took a long time to give grades back but gave extensions on assignments for the whole class because of the delay and other factors. The course isn't too hard but it was quite boring online. Textbook isn't needed- his slides are very detailed and based on the book.

Prof Prest was a very nice and knowledgable prof. At times I found the class unorganized. Someone with no political science background may find the material overwhelming as there was a range of topics and themes.

great instructor unfortunatley I was unable to submit a class evaluation and so i am opting to do so here in fact this is why i made an account here. he is super knowledgable and engaging material he teaches both well versed and not well versed subjects
Pol 151 was a very easy class. Especially with Stewart. Good lecturer, fair grader overall good choice.

When you see a 5.0 rating, it's tempting to think that the prof just reviewed themselves a bunch of times... Stewart is actually this good of a prof. He's the most solid combination of character, care and competence a prof can be. He's SO clear, uses recent examples, uploads the most helpful slides (including midterm/final reviews); top shelf prof!

Nice character. he is fun and has a nice approach to an otherwise boring subject. He used the text quite a bit, the questions for the exams were straight out of it. Impossible to do poorly if you prepare normally.

Difficult to understand at times (thick Italian accent) - but funny.  VERY limited class notes, test material is straight out of text (but verrry specific and nitpicky).  Class attendance basically non required, need to read textbook...DO NOT reccommend this class with this professor.

Nice guy, but his lectures are a joke. We literally learn nothing, so lectures are very skippable. The midterm was absurd (just a bunch of random questions) and the textbook doesnt help at all. The memo project seemed really hard, but it was marked pretty easily. Overall I regret taking this class and its probably the worst class I've taken so far.
